meanings.definition: Impressures: the act of impressing or making a strong impact
meanings.sent1: The impressures of her speech left a lasting impression on the audience.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting had beautiful impressures that captivated viewers.
meanings.sent3: The impressures of his dance moves were so powerful, they made everyone want to join in.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness left an impressure on my heart that I will never forget.
meanings.sent5: The impressures of the storm on the landscape were breathtaking to behold.

meanings.definition: Impressures: a mark or indentation left by pressure
meanings.sent1: The impressures on the clay showed the artist's skilled hands.
meanings.sent2: The impressures on the paper revealed the texture of the leaf pressed on it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally made impressures on the dough while trying to knead it gently.
meanings.sent4: The impressures on the snow resembled delicate lace patterns.
meanings.sent5: The impressures on the sand were like tiny footprints leading to the sea.

meanings.definition: Impressures: to make a strong impact or influence on someone or something
meanings.sent1: Her words always impressures me to be a better person.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker impressures the audience with his powerful message.
meanings.sent3: He impressures his friends with his amazing cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The song impressures upon the listener a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dedication impressures upon her students the importance of hard work.
